page.title: 16Primary School Events
page.content: At the end of each term our school holds a concert in the hall, and in the summer there is also an Open Day. There are class songs,- at Christmas a Nativity play by the infants,- and some children play solos on their own instruments and recorder groups play at the concerts. The parents and relatives come to watch free of charge. At Easter and Harvest-tide the Vicar comes and takes a small service. At the end of each school year a disco is held for the fourth years who will be leaving, but all the classes are welcome to come. Each class in the summer term goes on a trip to an interesting place. Each year the top class goes for four nights at the County's Nature Reserve, Hill End, at Farmoor. We stay in a dormitory and work in the sixty five acres there. In 1985 Radley school has 105 children.
